New Records: Glenn Maxwell broke the record for the fastest century in the Cricket World Cup history, scoring 106 runs off 44 balls
Maxwell's 40-ball hundred is the fourth-fastest ODI hundred
Key Match Events: Australia beat the Netherlands by 309 runs
The Netherlands was bowled out for a paltry 90 runs in 21 overs
Glenn Maxwell was out caught right after his century
Warner was out caught right after his century — holing out to fine leg off Logan van Beek
Post-Match Reflections: Glenn Maxwell said he was just trying to give himself and his team a good platform at the end
Maxwell said it was nice to get some rhythm in the tournament
He added that it was a good game with both bat and ball for us
Miscellaneous Highlights: The margin of victory was the largest (by runs) in World Cup history
It sharply elevated Australia’s net run-rate from -0.193 to +1.142
The Netherlands dropped from seventh to 10th in the table, with two points and below Sri Lanka, defending champions England and Bangladesh on run rate
Others: Australia faces New Zealand in Dharamsala on Saturday, when the Netherlands will play Bangladesh in Kolkata
